You can configure Custos mainly in two ways, either by directly editing the config files,
or by using the API via HTTP call or Web-UI.

Custos works with hot-reload configurations, which means that as soon as you update your configuration, whether via
the API or by editing the configuration files, Custos automatically uses the configuration without requiring a restart.

Custos configurations are split into namespaces according to their usage.
This is represented by the different config files you can see in the
To update the custos config via API either see the
api reference for the config endpoint
or the Configuration page in the Web-UI.
Docker compose will automatically create a directory called

containing all the configuration files
next to the
